ReviewList.Text: Physics: the easy way is a really good supplement to your studies, especially if you're going for an AP test.  However, there are quite a few mathematical errors, and not nearly enough practice problems.  The book is very well complemented by "The Physics Problem Solver", by REA.

This book summarizes the main points in a very lucid and concise manner with small number of carefully selected examples which emphasizes the main idea.  Because of the unique format of this book, students can grasp the main idea in a shortest time with minimal effort.  This book can be helpful to review the main ideas before the exams or to grasp the main idea before studying the subject in more detail.

I am taking college physics and it has been quite overwhelming.  I have looked at several Physic's books to get an understanding.  I turned to amazon.com to see more choices and ordered this book.  I am so happy.  I love this book and can hardly put it down.  Things are making sense now.  I just wish I had this book before I started the semester.  Thank you Mr. Lehrman.  If I could hug you, I would!

I purchased this book to help with the Engineering Physics class I'm enrolled in. When the textbook used in the class is confusing I pull this book out and it clears the problems up. Perfect as a resource.
This book does a decent enough job of getting points across simplistically and making the math understandable.  It can be slightly confusing at times though, but it's rare.
This book was very informative and covered topics not covered in my college text.  It is thorough and easy to understand.  I would recommend it to anyone at any level.
Another book for library.  Always looking for variety to help kids understand as they go through school.
I purchased this book to augment my Physics text (Giancoli).  This book is absolutely useless.  Many of the answers are incorrect.

I can't speak from the perspective of a struggling student, which I believe it was designed for.  I initially checked this book out from my local library as I was interested in gaining a better grasp of basic physics.  While there are many books on physics out there, this goes along the core concepts and math nicely, with each chapter focusing on more specific facets of the big picture.  The copy I ordered was $.01 and listed as "Acceptable" condition, which it was.  I'll note that, without a proper definition of "Acceptable" it's hard to know what to expect. The one I received had a single crack along the spine, slightly worn corners and notes/highlighted text throughout.  I don't mind it at all, and I kind of enjoy having key info noted already. I believe if you're merely trying to expand your understanding of Physics and not presenting this as a gift, "Acceptable" should be just fine.

I would still recommend buying; just don't waste time trying to resolve cases where your answer is different.  Another example is "try me" #6 in Chapter 2.  6.0 seconds - 2.0 seconds = 4 seconds, but the answer uses 3 elapsed seconds.  The simple presentations are indeed, "The easy way".  I bought this because I own "Calculus, the easy way", which is excellent 5 stars.
Its a barron book. I trust them all, I have not used it yet but feel confident it will be as good as all the other barron books I learn from
